pullRequest.body:
Main changes:

- add `Monic.mem_nonZeroDivisors` and `mem_nonZeroDivisors_of_leadingCoeff` which states that a monic polynomial (resp. a polynomial whose leading coefficient is not zero divisor) is not a zero divisor.
- add `rootMultiplicity_mul_X_sub_C_pow` which states that `* (X - a) ^ n` adds the root multiplicity at `a` by `n`.
- change the conditions in `rootMultiplicity_X_sub_C_self`, `rootMultiplicity_X_sub_C` and `rootMultiplicity_X_sub_C_pow` from `IsDomain` to `Nontrivial`.
- add `rootMultiplicity_eq_natTrailingDegree` which relates `rootMultiplicity` and `natTrailingDegree`, and `eval_divByMonic_eq_trailingCoeff_comp`.
- add `le_rootMultiplicity_mul` which is similar to `le_trailingDegree_mul`.
- add `rootMultiplicity_mul'` which slightly generalizes `rootMultiplicity_mul`

In `Data/Polynomial/FieldDivision`:

- add `rootMultiplicity_sub_one_le_derivative_rootMultiplicity_of_ne_zero` which slightly generalizes `rootMultiplicity_sub_one_le_derivative_rootMultiplicity`.
- add `derivative_rootMultiplicity_of_root_of_mem_nonZeroDivisors` which slightly generalizes `derivative_rootMultiplicity_of_root`.
- add several theorems relating roots of iterate derivative to `rootMultiplicity`

In addition:

- move `eq_of_monic_of_associated` from RingDivision to Monic and generalize.
- add `dvd_cancel` lemmas to NonZeroDivisors.
- add `algEquivOfCompEqX`: two polynomials that compose to X both ways induces an isomorphism of the polynomial algebra.
- add divisibility lemmas to Polynomial/Derivative.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Sorry for spamming various lemmas to mathlib. I think now this PR contains all the results I need for the properties of separable degree of polynomials.
I generalized div/modByMonic from CommRing to Ring in #8889 and renamed one lemma, so you need to fix that here :)

> Maybe @acmepjz could take a final look and then I'll call maintainer merge

Thank you very much for the changes; looks good to me.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7199881594/job/19612571291)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7199881594/job/19612570716)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7199881594/job/19612571027)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Maybe @acmepjz could take a final look and then I'll call maintainer merge

Thanks!
maintainer merge

(Note to maintainers: I personally added [lots of commits](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8563/files/e632d3a39c275afe47462f131f63079032042346..88c5ae6bc8dca16482ee384bfeac45db0dcf7f0e) but they are all golfs and extraction of lemmas/defs / generalization of existing lemmas, and I didn't end up changing any of @acmepjz's original statements.)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I think the name is too long ...
```suggestion
theorem mem_nonZeroDivisors_of_leadingCoeff {p : R[X]}
```
btw nonZeroDivisors has a scoped [notation](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/c6979569edc545f999b82d8a833b190c918aec2e/Mathlib/RingTheory/NonZeroDivisors.lean#L41)

> btw nonZeroDivisors has a scoped [notation](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/c6979569edc545f999b82d8a833b190c918aec2e/Mathlib/RingTheory/NonZeroDivisors.lean#L41)

However there is no `open scoped nonZeroDivisors` in this file yet. These two are only theorems about `nonZeroDivisors` so I think the use of notation will not significantly shorten the proof.
Can you inline the proof of `rootMultiplicity_mul_X_sub_C_pow'` into this one? The condition `p * (X - C a) ^ n â‰  0` is equivalent to `p â‰  0` but seems harder to verify.
But later I actually need the `rootMultiplicity_mul_X_sub_C_pow'` version to prove things...

If you know `p * (X - C a) ^ n â‰  0`, you can use [left_ne_zero_of_mul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/GroupWithZero/Basic.html#left_ne_zero_of_mul) before applying `rootMultiplicity_mul_X_sub_C_pow`.

```suggestion
  have := rootMultiplicity_mul_X_sub_C_pow (a := a) (n := n) C.map_one_ne_zero
```
(untested)
You might also use `rootMultiplicity_X_sub_C_pow` below to prove this. `rw [<- pow_one (X - C x), ...]`

The assumption `hpq` is not very natural and is equivalent to the product of the trailing degrees of `p (X + C x)` and `q (X + C x)` being nonzero; I imagine it could be easier to use [Polynomial.trailingDegree_mul'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/Degree/TrailingDegree.html#Polynomial.trailingDegree_mul') together with your proposed lemma `p.rootMultiplicity t = (aeval (X + C t) p).natTrailingDegree`, depending on your eventual goal. By the way, a more idiomatic spelling of `aeval (X + C t) p` is simply `p.comp (X + C t)`.

This is best I can come up with if not mentioning `trailingCoeff`. There is a theorem says that `(p /â‚˜ (X - C x) ^ (p.rootMultiplicity x)).eval x` is not zero if `p` itself is not zero. So I think this is sort-of reasonable assumption?

> By the way, a more idiomatic spelling of `aeval (X + C t) p` is simply `p.comp (X + C t)`.

But it looks like that `aeval` has better API (e.g. I can use `AlgHom` etc)

[EDIT] Nevermind,  `aeval (X + C t) p` is defeq to `p.comp (X + C t)` so I can use `change` ðŸ˜…

I understand that [Polynomial.trailingDegree_mul'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/Degree/TrailingDegree.html#Polynomial.trailingDegree_mul') uses this complicated expression. But I think it would be better if you show `(p /â‚˜ (X - C x) ^ (p.rootMultiplicity x)).eval x = (p.comp (X + C x)).trailingCoeff` and restate the lemma using the RHS; you'd have access to [Polynomial.trailingDegree_mul'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/Degree/TrailingDegree.html#Polynomial.trailingDegree_mul') which should facilitate the proof.

And I'm curious where do you need this lemma?

> And I'm curious where do you need this lemma?

No, I don't need this lemma yet ðŸ˜… In fact the only lemma I need to use is `one_lt_rootMultiplicity_iff_isRoot_gcd`.

Glad that you completed the proof!
Actually, making use of [Polynomial.aeval](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/AlgebraMap.html#Polynomial.aeval) may be more convenient here, as it's an AlgHom, actually an AlgEquiv in this case (composition with (X + C t) is inverse to composition with (X - C t)). Of course, divisibility is preserved by any AlgHom (even MulHom), which naturally yield this theorem.

(It may be a good idea to add MulEquivClass iff version of [map_dvd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Divisibility/Basic.html#map_dvd).)

> actually an AlgEquiv in this case (composition with (X + C t) is inverse to composition with (X - C t))

In fact I have an implementation:
```lean
def algEquivAevalXAddC : R[X] â‰ƒâ‚[R] R[X] :=
  AlgEquiv.ofAlgHom (aeval (X + C t)) (aeval (X - C t))
    (by apply algHom_ext; simp only [AlgHom.coe_comp, Function.comp_apply, aeval_X, map_sub,
      aeval_C, AlgHom.coe_id, id_eq, â† C_eq_algebraMap, add_sub_cancel])
    (by apply algHom_ext; simp only [AlgHom.coe_comp, Function.comp_apply, aeval_X, map_add,
      aeval_C, AlgHom.coe_id, id_eq, â† C_eq_algebraMap, sub_add_cancel])
```
But I can't find a way to use it to make the following proof shorter. So I haven't added it to the PR yet.

> It may be a good idea to add MulEquivClass iff version of [map_dvd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Divisibility/Basic.html#map_dvd).

I tried this, but it looks like that the lemmas regarding `AlgEquiv.ofAlgHom` is missing... anyway I quickly give up.
I pushed a commit to make use of your `algEquivAevalXAddC`, as well as extracting other API. Will look at the rest later.
Can you please extract `dvd_cancel_left/right_mem_nonZeroDivisors`?

There is [mul_dvd_mul_iff_left](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/GroupWithZero/Divisibility.html#mul_dvd_mul_iff_left) and [mul_dvd_mul_iff_right](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/GroupWithZero/Divisibility.html#mul_dvd_mul_iff_right). New lemmas should use different names...

Note to reviewers: These lemmas about CommRings need to stay here because Polynomial.derivative isn't imported in RingDivision, and #find_home suggests no other file. The other options are creating a new file or importing derivatives into RingDivision.

```suggestion
    (hpq : (p /â‚˜ (X - C x) ^ p.rootMultiplicity x).eval x *
      (q /â‚˜ (X - C x) ^ q.rootMultiplicity x).eval x â‰  0) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Polynomial/RingDivision): improvements to `Polynomial.rootMultiplicity`
